Reviews.Title: Phone for my 10 yr old
Reviews.Author: TaraJOhn
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for a replacement for my 10 yr old. He loves it and I love how easy it is to work.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Glenn Wilson
Reviews.Content: I'm a simple guy that wants a simple phone.  This was a replacement for the T239 I had previously and has since fallen apart from heavy use.  The functionality is very similar to my old phone, which I like, but there are a few upgrades from the T239.  This phone has 4 bands, a nicer screen, nicer sounds, and has expandable memory.  The only thing I miss is the ability to customize the soft keys, otherwise this is a great phone for those that don't want the fancy, expensive, and unnecessary internet connectivity found in today's smarty phones.

Reviews.Title: It's mostly represented to be what it actually is...mostly but?
Reviews.Author: David L "DLP"
Reviews.Content: I just received this phone and it was easy to switch my T-Mobile sim card from my old T-Mobile phone to this one.  I need this phone as it is interactive with the 2012 Honda CRV's audio system and works with it very well.  It's a nice, simple phone with the following major flaws.The only thing I wish it had is the ability to transmit my contacts to T-Mobile for backup, but it's not available for this phone.  And you cannot backup your contacts onto your microSD memory card either.  You can ONLY backup your contacts onto the phone's SIM card.  That's it!  So, if backing up your phone contacts is not very important to you this phone is a nice, simple phone for you.It's easy to use and understand and if you just want a simple "phone" it's just fine.

Reviews.Title: Relieved
Reviews.Author: ES Marshall
Reviews.Content: In this time of progressive phones that do everything else besides what you need - Call someone, Text someone - just a regular phone is hard to come by. I'm pretty simple these days, but still pretty cautious, esp. with online purchasing. This was my first buy for such an item, but it won't be my last. My daughter's phone is about to die soon and I'm not looking to get her another phone with tons of opts and apps. A plain phone like this will suffice.I was worried when it showed up so quickly, but then saw that it was in perfect shape too, I was Very Happy =)

Reviews.Title: great for a cheap pohne
Reviews.Author: dennis p
Reviews.Content: got this phone for my mom.  my parents have a phone under my contract and they dont use a lot of min, maybe 70 min at the most a month and they only needed it for making phone calls .  this phone is not complicated at all and battery life is ok, about 4 days goes by without charging the battery

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done surprisingly well for a prepaid phone
Reviews.Author: G. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: What you get out of the box:SGH-t249 phoneRechargeable batterySGH-t249 user manualSGH-t249 user manual(in spanish)Accessory guideAC adapter1.3 MP Camera.Supports microSD card.It does not come with a sims card nor mini-usb cable.After using it for a few months, my impressions on this phone.Impressive battery life. Can go 10 days or more on standby without charging.Picture quality with the phone camera isn't that great. You can set it to save your pictures to your micoSD card instead of your phone which is great! Very bright lights makes it difficult to take a good picture with this phone.Reception is good and haven't noticed any dropped calls. No static during calls.Known issue with the voicemail. If you let this phone's battery drain completely. After recharging it, they're will be a voicemail indicator eventhough you will have no new voicemail message. It will remain there until you call T-Mobile customer support to remove it. They say its a known issue and can't be fixed.Music player on this phone is good. I put in my old 1gb microSD card from another phone. Add and edited songs to my playlist and off I go. Each playlist hold 50 songs and there are 10 playlist available. Wish the MegaPixels was higher for the camera.It fills my expectations for a simple prepaid phone.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Henry Lee
Reviews.Content: Product came in sealed but slightly damaged original packaging. All items were in box as listed in the ad. When I called T-Mobile to activate the phone, I was told the SIM card included was "in cold status". It could not be activated nor could the status be changed. Despite my arguments w/different employees, I was told I needed to buy a new SIM card for $25. This is T-Mobile policy for any of their phones not purchased at one of their stores. It would apply even if I got the phone from a local chain store.It's possible the original box was opened & the original SIM card switched w/another & resealed. I advise going to a T-Mobile store or their website to order.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Cullen775
Reviews.Content: Great pre-paid phone that I purchased for my mom. She loves it! It's actually her second one because the first one had water damage.

Reviews.Title: It's great
Reviews.Author: klya
Reviews.Content: This phone is good, it does everything that it says it'll do. its not as good as a expensive phone, but it'll still get the job done. the video recorder and camera is pretty good and the music player works fine as well. It usually has great reception and internet connection is fast and easy. The only down side is that it doesn't have a keyboard, so typing anything into the phone is a pain, butif you have patience you should be just fine. I've had mine for about a year now and I've dropped it at least 10 times on my concrete driveway and other places, and it still works like its new. Seriously, I have never had any problems with this phone.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: felicia
Reviews.Content: I love my phone and it came to me well secure. The packaging was great and I love my phone.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PHONE!!!
Reviews.Author: Christen J. Reimer "GAME SONIC"
Reviews.Content: AWESOME PHONE!!! At first, I had trouble deciding between this phone and the Sparq but after hearing from one of my friends that the Sparq was not as good, I chose this phone. PROS: The color blue on it is nice and slide out buttons work good. Message sending is fast and camera is alright. Web2go is fast and has a wide selection of stuff for a basic phone. Easy exiting the phone.CONS: It will make a beeping noise it makes when it's low on power but that just a signal telling you to charge it. Not a wide selection of marks like !@#$%^&*() when texting (Since it doesn't come with a QWERTY keyboard).Overall 5 stars Must buy phone if your looking for a prepaid.

Reviews.Title: Phone has some irritating flaws
Reviews.Author: Ormewood
Reviews.Content: The back of this phone started falling off after a few weeks of use.  It's held in by tiny plastic tabs which fail to do their job after a small amount of wear.  I resorted to taping the back on to keep it from falling off all the time.If you don't set the phone up so that the keyboard is locked when it's slid shut, the phone's buttons get pressed as it moves around in your pocket, and you end up autodialing people on your contact list a few times every day.  If you do set it up so that the keyboard is locked when it's slid shut, it still beeps constantly as you move around.  Even if locked, it sometimes comes unlocked and you end up finding out that another chunk of your prepaid time has been used to go on the web or autodial someone.

Reviews.Title: Merchant Supplies Phone With Invalid SIM Card
Reviews.Author: RICH ROCHELLE
Reviews.Content: The Samsung T249 is an excellent phone for my needs; I ordered it to replace a lost T249, but a cellphone is useless without a SIM card. When I contacted the Amazon  Merchant who supplied the phone and advised him that T-Mobile would not accept the card supplied with the phone; the merchant denied any responsibility and referred me to Amazon.  Amazon Customer Service refunded the cost of the phone.

Reviews.Title: Awful, awful product
Reviews.Author: Alexey V
Reviews.Content: There is no way to disable the buttons on the phone's face so they would be activated only when the phone is slid open. There is also no way to turn the keyboard sounds off completely. So, when the phone is in a pocket or a bag, the very sensitive keys on the face get pushed by something and turn on the screen, draining the battery, and also making annoying bipping sounds - all the time. In addition, I constantly "refuse" to take calls because I accidently push a wrong button while taking the ringing phone out of pocket. Really, really bad design...

Reviews.Title: samsung cell
Reviews.Author: tony barrett
Reviews.Content: got this  for the  wife  but she  did not like it  she thought  it was  easy to use  so she  gave it to her  friend  to use

Reviews.Title: Smart buy
Reviews.Author: Nypepe
Reviews.Content: I bougt this phone for my mom.  She is a old women and need big numbers, easy to use phone.  The old people need cellphones not smartphones.  The big cellphone company don't have phones easy to use the old people.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this phone!
Reviews.Author: mad-alchemist
Reviews.Content: T-Mobile refused to activate the phone.  They claimed that the SIM serial number and the phone serial number were both invalid.  After much discussion with several T-Mobile customer service reps, most of whom clearly spoke English as a second language, I was informed that the phone could not be activated because the seller had not "scanned it out of their system" whatever that means.  T-Mobile had no interest in resolving the issue; they just kept telling me to return the phone to the seller.  My advice: don't buy this phone and don't use T-Mobile.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE !!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Martha Powers "Martha Powers"
Reviews.Content: After enduring two years of this thing going "blip" in my purse all the time, it seems to have died.  HURRAY!When I turn the phone on, it turns itself back off immediately.But the worst feature all this time is the buttons on the side.  I have almost NEVER received a call without accidentally REJECTING it because when I lunge for the ringing phone, I accidentally bump a button on the side and reject the call.I am SO GLAD this BLASTED PIECE OF JUNK is dead at last!By the way, you can't download ring tones to it, so you have to live with T-Mobile lousy sound, which builds in a crescendo, getting louder and louder as you frantically try not to drop the incoming call.  Stress city!

ProductInfo.Features:
Compact slider phone for voice communication as well as text and instant messaging
Pay for just the minutes you use with no annual contract--easy refill via Internet or prepaid cards
1.3-megapixel camera; Bluetooth stereo music; microSD memory expansion; personal organizer tools
Up to 4.5 hours of talk time, up to 312 hours (13 days) of standby time; released in October, 2010
What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, quick start guide
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung T249 Prepaid Phone, Blue (T-Mobile)
